title: Small-Sided Games-Based Instructional Design Workshop for Youth Soccer Tactical Behavior Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of Sports Science, Educational Theory, and Soccer Match Analysis Experience
context.additional_context: Learners are office/administrative professionals with soccer coaching or sports science research experience, aiming to acquire practical knowledge applicable to designing youth training programs.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the impact of various small-sided game (SSCG) configurations (e.g., Gk+3vs3+Gk, Gk+4vs4+Gk) on tactical behaviors of youth athletes (U15/U17).
Learners can utilize tools to assess the influence of rule manipulations (e.g., ball possession maintenance, breakthrough at target zones) on team strategic exploration behaviors.
Learners can design age-specific (U15/U17) SSCG training programs and measure effectiveness using simple performance indicators.

resources: Youth athlete behavior observation record sheet

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
